result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas L Alvarado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:01am.
Defendant Nicholas L Alvarado in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Alvarado makes a statement.

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Alvarado to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith 

On Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Alvarado to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to Count #1

On Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Alvarado to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to Count #1 & #2

Days credit for time already served given: 98 days 

The Court orders Mr. Alvarado to pay court-ordered financial obligations during the Sentence-period [due date: 1/6/18]. Thereafter the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any balance due on unpaid court-ordered financial obligations.
recess 9:16am.

Case called at 3:22pm [mo]
Defendant Nicholas L Alvarado in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1, #2, and #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Alvarado

On Counts #1, #2 and #3 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--On Count #1: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on 12/27 /15 at    6:00    pm.
---Mr. Alvarado is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Absolute sobriety of all non-prescribed controlled substances and alcohol 
--No presence at any Havill Spoerl Property, except for work purposes and as approved by DOC
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender, except during treatment, or as approved by DOC
--no contact with Sarah Lapp, Josiah Onasch, Jacqueline Witt and Paul McDonald
--Mr. Alvarado shall comply with random drug and alcohol screening at the discretion of DOC
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  2  days

[MK] case called at 1:27pm. 
Defendant Nicholas L. Alvarado appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (for bond purposes only; PD eligibility has not been determined).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Right to counsel given. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at any Havill Spoerl property
--no contact with John Chady, Brian King, Daryl Spoerl, or Jacqueline Witt
--no contact with Sarah Lapp, Paul MacDonald, or Josiah Onasch
recess 1:32pm.
